page.title: 07THE FIRE STATION KNUTSFORD
page.content: The Fire Station was opened in 1964. It takes one minute to get ready to go. They have got two water tenders and one rescue tender. They can fit six men in an engine. Their fastest speed on a motorway is between 80 - 85 miles per hour and 50 to 60 on normal roads. In one year Knutsford had 800 fires. Some fires take three or four days to put out. They get more fires when children are on holiday. There are twelve firemen and one Chief Officer. All the equipment is paid for from the rates. They keep a record of all the fires. The fire engine is big and the seats are hard. The area covered by this station is Stockton Heath, Altrincham, Northwich and Holmes Chapel.
